docs.lead_paragraph: So much for the spiritual significance of those near-death experiences. The tunnel and the light that people talk about seeing has something to do with vision-control neurons firing at random. And the sense of euphoria and inner peace just comes from various brain chemicals at work. The same thing happens to test pilots undergoing ''gravity-induced loss of consciousness'' in the centrifuge. As for the dream of middle age -- turning back the clock by shaping up now with the right diet and exercise -- forget it. The body is just a big photocopying machine (making new cells that are supposed to be duplicates of the existing cells), and it tends to make inferior copies. Taking better care of the machine now might help slow down the deterioration of future copies, but it couldn't turn the process back to copying from the original.

headline.main: Ah, if the Body Only Made Original Copies
